title: news.com.au — Australia’s #1 news site
text: The major criticisms of Sydney’s Kingsford Smith airport are being addressed in the design of the new airport in the city’s west, according to Urban Infrastructure Minister Alan Tudge. Speaking to Sky News host Sharri Markson, Mr Tudge said issues with Kingsford Smith including its curfew, the fact that it is “getting close to capacity”, and its car-parking constraints have been considered when drawing up the plans for the new western Sydney airport. Plans for the appearance and layout of the new 24-hour airport at Badgery's Creek were revealed on Tuesday, which is due to open in 2026. Image: News Corp Australia
